title: Compute Engine üñ•Ô∏è
ques: What is Google Cloud's Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) offering that lets you create and run virtual machines?
explanation: Compute Engine delivers virtual machines running in Google's innovative data centers and worldwide fiber network.

title: Cloud Storage ü™£
ques: Which service offers unified object storage for developers and enterprises, capable of storing any amount of data?
explanation: Cloud Storage provides worldwide, highly durable object storage that scales to exabytes of data.

title: Cloud Functions ‚ö°
ques: What is Google Cloud's lightweight, event-based, asynchronous compute solution (Serverless)?
explanation: Cloud Functions allows you to create single-purpose, stand-alone functions that respond to cloud events without managing servers.

title: BigQuery üìä
ques: Which fully managed, serverless data warehouse enables super-fast SQL queries using the processing power of Google's infrastructure?
explanation: BigQuery is designed for analyzing data volume at the petabyte scale with high speed and zero operational overhead.

title: App Engine üöÄ
ques: What is the fully managed Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) for building and deploying web applications and mobile backends?
explanation: App Engine allows you to focus on writing code while Google manages the infrastructure availability and scaling.
